channel.title: If you were to die tomorrow
channel.description:
What would you do?
Wouldn't your perspective on life change? I can imagine waking up and feeling shitty, realizing it would be the last time I would feel this. I would brush my teeth, then do it again, because I would never have the chance to do it again. The most mundane menial tasks would have so much more meaning. Eating breakfast. Washing the dishes. You could never get over the fact that it would be the last time you would ever do something like that. Any thoughts?

Ok. When i was a newborn my grandmother was holding me and the nurse tht i guess was taking care of my infant self. walked past my grandma with a sneer and a sad face and she tripped over a wire and she had a needle in her hand and it flung out of her hand and it scratched my head severley and i guess it scratched my skull.
